page.title: 07GYPSIES
page.content:
Gypsies have traditionally stayed for periods of a few weeks on areas of open land within this D-block.In June 1985 there were six caravans on rough ground beside the B3013.
Over the last twenty years, there has been a decrease in available sites because land is being used more intensively.This has caused more pressure on remaining sites.The county council is being asked by gypsies and local residents to provide permanent sites for travelling people.One such site is due to open soon nearby.There will be concrete bases,water,drainage.
Where up to thirty caravans have congregated for months recently,along the A30,there are now mounds up to two metres high,to prevent further access.
